alert.note: Alert for Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 2:19PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Osceola County through 245 PM EDT... At 218 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Lake Marian. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Osceola County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
